intro: Boehmeria bicuspis, commonly known as the two-toothed hemp or Chinese nettle, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its small greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Boehmeria bicuspis is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber.
